issues.title: Missing Student Directory Information Policy and Procedures
issues.description: California law requires districts to establish policies regarding student directory information, including what constitutes directory information, annual notification to parents/guardians, opt-out procedures, and restrictions on disclosure. This is a fundamental student privacy requirement that is completely absent from both documents.

legal_citations.text: Each school district shall inform parents and guardians of pupils in attendance and pupils in attendance who are 18 years of age or older annually of their rights regarding directory information... Directory information may be disclosed unless a parent or guardian of a pupil or a pupil who is 18 years of age or older has previously submitted a written request to the school district that any or all directory information relating to that pupil not be disclosed without the prior written consent of a parent or guardian of the pupil or the pupil.

issues.required_language: The district shall annually notify parents/guardians and eligible students of their rights regarding directory information. Directory information includes: student's name, address, telephone number, email address, date and place of birth, major field of study, participation in officially recognized activities and sports, weight and height of members of athletic teams, dates of attendance, degrees and awards received, and most recent previous school attended. Parents/guardians and eligible students may opt out of directory information disclosure by submitting written notice to the district.

issues.title: Missing Student Records Access and Disclosure Provisions
issues.description: Federal FERPA and California law require specific policies regarding access to and disclosure of student education records, including procedures for parent/student access, amendment procedures, and disclosure limitations. These fundamental student privacy protections are not addressed in either document.

legal_citations.text: The parent or guardian of a pupil or former pupil, or a pupil who is 18 years of age or older, has the absolute right to access any and all pupil records related to their child or themselves which are maintained by school districts or private schools.

issues.required_language: Parents/guardians and eligible students have the right to inspect and review student education records, request amendments to inaccurate records, and receive notice of disclosures. The district shall maintain a record of disclosures and limit access to authorized personnel with legitimate educational interests.

issues.title: Missing Complaint Procedures for Privacy Rights Violations
issues.description: Federal law requires districts to provide procedures for parents/guardians to file complaints regarding alleged violations of student privacy rights. Neither document establishes these required complaint procedures.

legal_citations.text: The Secretary shall establish or designate an office to investigate, process, review, and adjudicate violations of the provisions of this section and complaints which may be filed concerning alleged violations of this section.

issues.required_language: Parents/guardians may file complaints regarding alleged violations of student privacy rights with the district and with the U.S. Department of Education's Student Privacy Policy Office. The district shall establish procedures for investigating and resolving such complaints.

issues.title: Incomplete Reference to Required Notifications
issues.description: The Board Policy references notification requirements for "items #1-4 above" but the actual policy lists 5 items. This creates confusion about which activities require notification and may result in incomplete compliance with notification requirements.

legal_citations.text: All instructional materials, including teacher's manuals, films, tapes, or other supplementary material which will be used in connection with any survey, analysis, or evaluation as part of any applicable program shall be available for inspection by the parents or guardians of the children.

issues.required_language: The Superintendent or designee shall notify parents/guardians of the adoption or continued use of the district's policy pertaining to all rights specified in items #1-5 above.
